title: PMP Exam Full - 180 Questions
description: A comprehensive PMP practice exam covering PMBOK People, Process, and Business Environment domains with 180 questions and full explanations. Includes 7 public-source sample questions appended.

questions.question: A company has recurring quality issues with one of its sole source suppliers. A new project will incur significant penalties from the customer if deliverables are late What should the project manager do?
options: Identify high- level risks prior to developing contingency plans
Negotiate with other vendors with better quality-control methods.
Review incoming inspection reports and quality logs
Escalate the issue to top management
questions.explanation:
In the (past projects) the company has recurring quality issues with one of its sole source suppliers. in 
the ( new project ((will )) Incur significant penalties from the customer ((( if ))) deliverables are late. So 
this is high level risk and should be initially take into consideration, then in the planning phase, the 
project manager should conducts a mitigation plan to reduce this risk such as conduct more tests and 
Review incoming inspection reports and quality logs. Since its sole source then you dont have any 
other option to negotiate with other vendors with better quality-control methods.. Therefor you have 
to consider this risk while you are planning the project. Since you should be proactive so the 
escalation process to top management is the last decision.

questions.question: Before initiating any such project, the value of the project to the organization must be determined. Which of the following is the most critical factor to be considered in such a scenario?
options: Investment requirement
Net Present Value (NPV) of the projects.
Alignment with the strategic goals.
Internal Rate of Return (IRR) of the projects.
questions.explanation: All projects must be Alignment with the strategic goals to the organization.

questions.question: You are creating your activity list, but only for the next two portions of the project. The rest of the work you are leaving at the work package level. What approach are you using?
options: Brainstorming
Progressive elaboration
Predictive life cycle
Bottom up PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
Progressive elaboration Is The Iterative process of Increasing the level of detail in a project 
management plan as greater amounts of information and more accurate estimates become available.

questions.question: If the project was terminated early, why would the project manager insist that the team perform the Close Project or Phase process?
options: To document the reasons why the project was terminated early, and how to transfer the finished and unfinished deliverables to others
The project manager should insist this is a waste of the team members' time since no one wants the project or its output any longer.
To make sure everyone knows that the reason for project termination was his fault or the fault of the team.
To document lessons learned so mistakes won't be repeated in future projects.
questions.explanation:
When the project terminated early, the project manager should direct the team to document the 
reasons why the project was terminated early, and how to transfer the finished and unfinished 
deliverables to others

questions.question: A company's PMO has been trying to implement an adaptive approach and a project manager has been asked to use adaptive tools in their next project. This is not the first time the request has been made, and the previous project falled when adaptive tools were implemented. What should the project manager do?
options: Conduct individual interviews with key stakeholders in order to understand all concerns then prepare a communication management plan.
Prepare a change request and seek approval from the steering committee regarding the new project framework.
Bring third-party company to develop and implement a hybrid framework for this specific projec
Recommend to the PMO that it's not the right time to start implementing adaptive tools in projects.
questions.explanation:
The previous project falled when adaptive tools were implemented, the project manager should Bring 
a third-party company to develop and implement a hybrid framework for this specific project. 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: Which of the following techniques used in adaptive lifecycles helps in minimizing scope creep:
options: Time-boxing
User stories
Product owner
Iterations
questions.explanation:
Time-boxed periods are durations during which the team works steadily toward completion of a goal. 
Time-boxing helps to minimize scope creep as it forces the teams to process essential features first, 
then other features when time permits.

questions.question: While performing project work, a team member notices that there is a potential new risk, which could impact the project's critical path. What should the tear member do immediately?
options: Recommend the project be placed on hold for a day to avoid the risk
Generate a risk report using qualitative analysis of the identified risk to alert the team of the schedule impacts
Document the risk in the risk register
Draft an emergency fallback plan since the critical path is in jeopardy
questions.explanation:
The risk register acts as a repository in which Identified risks are recorded, Including the outputs of 
other risk management processes. The Immediate first step for the team member to take Is to 
document the new risk in the risk register so that it will not be forgotten. The team member should 
then consult the project risk management plan for information about what to do next.

questions.question: You are a project manager of a new digital solution project. You have created all the necessary plans and activities to ensure a successful integration and solutions launch. There is a risk of a partner's system being unavailable which could impact the project negatively. What key activity is needed to ensure the project's success?
options: Mitigate the risk by developing alternative plans to make the solution ready and available without full integration capabilities.
Eliminate the risk by mandating the partner to change the system settings to facilitate easier integration with the new solution.
Communicate to the project stakeholders that full integration may not be possible and that the project will potentially be delayed as a resu PMP Test Bank 2
Continuously monitor the risk of the partner system's unavailability and put the proper solution plans in place in case the risk materializes into an actual issue.
questions.explanation:
A key activity that is needed to ensure the project's success is Continuously monitoring the risk of the 
partner system's unavallability and put the proper solution plans in place in case the risk materializes 
into an actual Issue.

questions.question: You are a project manager in a construction project. During the implementation phase, you observe conflicts between project stakeholders, resulting in deliverable and output approval delays. Which area should you focus?
options: Revisiting the project management plan to ensure deliverables are on time.
Reviewing the business documents and identifying gaps within scope.
Revisiting the stakeholder engagement plan, focusing on specific overlooked stakeholders.
Increasing the frequency of project update meetings to keep stakeholders informed.
questions.explanation:
The stakeholder engagement plan is a component of the project management plan that identifies the 
strategles and actions required to promote the productive involvement of stakeholders in decision-
making and execution. The stakeholder engagement plan identifles the management strategies and 
actions required to effectively engage stakeholders. So the project manager should be Revisiting the 
stakeholder engagement plan, focusing on specific overlooked stakeholders.

questions.question: If an Agile team planned to complete 30 story points in an Iteration but worked at only 83% of the rate planned. What is the project's SPI?
options: SPI cannot be determined from the given information.
25 story points
36 story points
questions.explanation:
If the team worked at only 83% story points the SPI Is 0.83. The productivity of 83% means that the 
team was only able to complete 25 story points during the Iteration. [Agile Practice Gulde, 1st edition, 
Page 69] 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: In an agile project, the project manager finds that the team members are involved in several Different projects due to budget constraints. As a project manager, what should you do?
options: Instruct the team members to spread evenly across projects so mistakes will not occur within the current budget.
Request the project sponsor prioritize and if necessary, allocate additional budget so the team can work on a single project
Provide an incentive plan so the team members will work more unaccounted hours on multiple projects
Brainstorm with the team members on how they can deliver on multiple projects within the given budget
questions.explanation:
The agile team should work on a single project. So the project manager should Request the project 
sponsor to prioritize and if necessary, allocate additional budget so the team can work on a single 
project. 
Very Important Question for the real exam!

questions.question: A highly skilled team resource received a job offer and is leaving the project soon. What should the project manager do to maintain project performance while a new team member is being onboarded?
options: Log a risk in the risk register and work with the new team member to mitigate it
Share project documents with the new team member
Motivate the new team member to perform.
Offer to cross-train and mentoring to the new team member
questions.explanation: Offer to cross-train and mentoring to the new team member

questions.question: A project manager met with the project team weekly to evaluate the project's progress. However, the sponsor requests that project performance be checked daily. The key team members disagree with this requirement and argue that they do not have enough time to go to daily meetings because they are at an executive level. What should the project manager do first? PMP Test Bank 2
options: Evaluate the capacity of each team member to attend daily meetings in person or virtually and reduce the time of each meeting.
Negotiate with the key team members to send a daily report and let the sponsor know that the project cost will increase.
Review the communications management plan and submit a change request if required
Recommend to the sponsor that performance of the project be reviewed once per week.
questions.explanation:
The correct answer is : 
Review the communications management plan and submit a change request if required.

questions.question: A team member has very strong technical skills and is interested in a leadership role. A leadership position opens up outside of the team in the organization. The project manager has observed that the team member has a major gap in communicating in a professional manner. What should the project manager do?
options: Recommend the team member for effective communication training and support their career development interests.
Ask the team member to refrain from pursuing new opportunities as they are not a suitable fit for a leadership position.
iggest the team member focus on positions with technical aspects and possible technical career opportunitie
Encourage the team member to stay in their current role as they are important to the project
questions.explanation:
Recommend the team member for effective communication training and support their career 
development interests.

questions.question: A project manager is part of an organization that is assessing the use of agile delivery approaches. A new project management office (PMO) manager who had a bad experience with a Scrum approach recommended that the project board replace Scrum with a predictive approach. What should the project manager do?
options: Review the communications management plan to identify new stakeholders.
Define a risk management plan for the new approach, as needed.
Define a project management plan for the new approach, as needed.
Review the benefits realization plan to include the cost of the change. PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation: Review the benefits realization plan to include the cost of the change.

questions.question: A project team has finished its first iteration out of six. The iteration's delivery performance (velocity) was 50%. During the iteration retrospective, the team realizes that the complexity of the work was underestimated. What should the project manager do?
options: Ask to replace some team members with more experienced ones.
Update the issue log and escalate it to the project sponsor.
Ask the technical manager to help the team with the issue.
Meet with the team to review internal actions to resolve the situation.
questions.explanation: Meet with the team to review Internal actions to resolve the situation.

questions.question: While a project manager is trying to build the first baseline for a project, a change request is being sent from one of the functional managers. What should the project manager do?
options: Discuss this with the functional manager and related parties.
Analyze the impact of the change request on the project.
Reject the functional manager's change request immediately.
Apply for a formal change control board (CCB) approval.
questions.explanation: Analyze the impact of the change request on the project.

questions.question: A major public-transportation construction project is aimed at significantly reducing emissions. The project has been severely delayed due to non-compliance with environmental codes and bylaws. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
options: Mapped environmental compliance requirements, identified risks to achieving them, and prepared mitigations.
Incorporated sufficient schedule reserves based on similar delays in past projects.
Approached the regulator for a partial waiver in light of the environmental importance of the project.
Appointed a senior environmental compliance officer to report directly to the project manager. PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
Mapped environmental compliance requirements, Identified risks to achieving them, and prepared 
mitigations.

questions.question: A project team is conducting sprint planning. Based on the estimated effort, only 95% of the items included in the sprint may be delivered. The product owner asks the project manager for advice on how to prioritize the backiog items. What should be used to prioritize the backlog items?
options: Technical complexity
Estimation accuracy
Business value
Risk to delivery
questions.explanation: Business value

questions.question: During the implementation phase, the project manager identifies a new project activity that will not affect the project end date. What should the project manager do next?
options: Create a change request.
Update the schedule baseline and Begin working on the new task immediately
Ask the sponsor to approve the new activity.
Update the change log and update the schedule baseline
questions.explanation:
Although the new project activity does not affect the end date of the project, but it may affect the 
scope baseline and the other project constraints, therefore the project manager should submit the 
change request first and take approval from CCB.

questions.question: A project team member identifies a simple change that will improve product quality without impacting the project budget. What should the project manager do?
options: Have team members include it in their assignments as quickly as possible.
Meet with the team member to assess the impact, and follow the change control proces
Ask the sponsor for their advice regarding the suggested change.
After reviewing the change, include it in the quality management plan. PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
The change does not impact the budget but maybe Impact the other constraints.. SO the project 
manager should Meet with the team member to assess the impact, and follow the change control 
process ...

questions.question: A new government regulation requires financial resources to be added to a project Due to this regulation, A new key stakeholder request to add another project activity What should the project manager do?
options: Execute the new activity because it was requested by the key stakeholder.
Update the schedule to include the new activity because it was requested by the key stakeholder.
Use funding allocated to other activities to execute the key stakeholder's request.
Document the request from the key stakeholder and perform the change request procedure
questions.explanation:
The project manager should Document the request from the key stakeholder and perform the change 
request procedure.. Other options not correct because the change request should be approved before 
Updating the pan or Executing the new activity..

questions.question: Which of the following responsibilities is NOT one of the Scrum Master's
options: Reminding the team of the process
Facilitating meetings
Removing impediments
Assigning tasks to team members
questions.explanation:
Scrum Master should encourage team members to self-organize while picking up the tasks. He/She 
should not assign them. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: Which of the following main events are defined by the Scrum Framework?
options: Sprint Planning Meeting. Sprint Retrospective Meeting. Sprint Review Meeting, and Mid-Sprint Status Review Meetin
Sprint Planning Meeting. Sprint Retrospective Meeting. Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily Scrum Meeting.
Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting. Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily XP Meeting.
Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting. Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily Kanban Meeting.
questions.explanation:
The main events are defined by the Scrum Framework: Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective 
Meeting, Sprint Revlew Meeting, and Dally Scrum Meeting. PMI Agile Practice guide page, 101

questions.question: You are a scrum master leading an agile project team that has been consistently meeting the goals set for each Iteration. However, you feel that one team member is less productive than the others. What is the most appropriate feedback approach for you to take in this situation?
options: From the next iteration onward, assign the team member the easiest user stories
Allow the project team members to address the issue if they deem necessary
Call out the team member's low productivity at the upcoming iteration retrospective
Direct the underperforming team member to work extra hours to bridge the gap
questions.explanation:
Agile teams are self-organizing and self-managing. The scrum master may provide servant leadership 
and guidance with agile best practices, but the team should collaborate to complete the work rather 
than being directed by the scrum master. Agile Practice guide page, 39

questions.question: An agile team is tasked with the development of a robot. The project manager wants to ensure that before the actual robot is built, the team receives early feedback on requirements and adapts the design accordingly. Which of the following should the project manager use to achieve that goal?
options: Business case
Design review
Prototyping
Checklists PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
Prototyping supports the concept of progressive elaboration in Iterative cycles, such as those used on 
agile projects described in the scenario. When enough feedback cycles have been performed, the 
requirements obtained from the prototype are sufficiently complete to move to the design or build 
phase.

questions.question: At the end of an Iteration, the product owner rejects the work items developed and provides feedback. What should an agile team do to avoid this situation in the future?
options: Ensure the product owner attends daily standups to understand the current status.
Document the product owners' feedback in the retrospective session.
Ensure the product owner is part of daily agile team activities and provides feedback.
Schedule frequent backlog refinement sessions with the product owner to clarify acceptance criteria
questions.explanation:
The agile team should document the product owners' feedback in the retrospective session. 
Retrospectives occur after every Iteration and at the end of every project. Conducting a retrospective 
encourages the team to review what went well and what could have been done better. This 
assessment includes the work on the product, but also the processes, team dynamics, and other areas 
that influence the effectiveness of the team

questions.question: There is a conflict between two members on how they complete a task. The conflict is not yet escalated to the project manager and there is no impact to the project. What should the project manager do?
options: Allow the project team members to find a resolution to their conflict.
Help facilitate a satisfactory conflict resolution.
Reassign both resources to different projects.
Ask the functional managers to get involved and facilitate a resolution.
questions.explanation:
Since the conflict Is not yet escalated to the project manager and there is no impact to the project, the 
project manager should Allow the project team members to find a resolution to their confict 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: One of your project team members doesn't finish his tasks on time. As a project manager, what should you do next?
options: Schedule training sessions for the team member to optimize his performance.
Release a team member
Conduct One-on-One Meeting with the team member
Meeting with the project team members and evaluate the impact on the project.
questions.explanation:
The first step Is to Conduct One-on-One Meeting with the team member to understand why he leaves 
the site early and why he does not finish his tasks on time.

questions.question: As a project manager, you are leading a software development project as a result of observation and conversation, you notice some of the team members need to improve their skills. What should you do FIRST?
options: Review the Resource Management Plan
Acquire new members
Schedule training sessions for the team member to optimize his performance.
Update Cost Baseline
questions.explanation:
The Resource Management Plan Include Training strategles and Methods for developing the project 
team.

questions.question: Your project is very complex and due to a scope change, you need a few additional experts, which you did not think of earlier. You request that your company provide you with some experts for consultancy work. Although your company has provided you with those experts, they are located in a different geographical location. In this situation, how will you get their input?
options: Recruit new members with same skills
Create a virtual team
Ask management to bring them to you
None of the above
questions.explanation:
If your experts are located in different geographical locations and you need their input, you will create 
a virtual team including all these experts

questions.question: During project execution, a project manager learns that a team member's functional manager belleves they shouldn't execute a certain task. What document should the project manager review to resolve this?
options: Work breakdown structure (WBS)
Resource management plan
Organisational chart
RACI (responsible, accountable, consult, and inform) chart
questions.explanation:
The RACI chart is useful for ensuring team members' roles and responsibilities are clear, especially 
when the team consists of Internal and external resources. 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: Two team members on your project often disagree. You need a conflict resolution method that provides a long-term resolution. You decide to use which one of the following approaches?
options: Smoothing
Withdrawal
Problem solving
Compromise
questions.explanation:
( Problem-solving ) which provides a long-term resolution. Collaborate/problem solve. Incorporating 
multiple viewpoints and insights from differing perspectives; requires a cooperative attitude and open 
dialogue that typically leads to consensus and commitment. This approach can result in a win-win 
situation.

questions.question: While you are in one of the first meetings for your new project that you have been assigned to early, two team members were discussing new ideas that each one thinks is correct and their opinion is the best for the project. You didn't interact or cut the discussion, as you know this is a normal discussion in this phase, which Is?
options: Norming
Performing
Supporting
Storming
questions.explanation:
Storming. During this phase, the team begins to address the project work, technical decisions, and the 
project management approach. If team members are not collaborative or open to differing ideas and 
perspectives, the environment can become counterproductive.

questions.question: A project manager wants to recruit another team member to replace an architect who resigned. What document should capture this change?
options: Ground rules
Organizational process Assets.
Responsibility assignments matrix (RAM)
Project management plan. PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
RAMS are used within the group to designate roles, responsibilities, and levels of authority for specific 
activities. The matrix format shows all activities assoclated with one person and all people assoclated 
with one activity. This also ensures that there Is only one person accountable for any one task to avoid 
confusion about who is ultimately in charge or has authority for the work.

questions.question: A conflict appeared between two members of your team, and the conflicts began to affect the entire project team. The team's morale has become low. As a project manager, what should you do?
options: Escalate the problem to the HR department.
Do nothing
Ask the team members to solve the conflict by themselves
Intertering for solving the problem immediately
questions.explanation:
The project manager must interfere to solve the problem immediately because the confilct start to 
impact the entire project team and the moral has become low.

questions.question: You are a project manager for Steco Company. Two team members come to you with a dispute regarding who will perform and report the status of a particular task. To resolve the conflict, which document will you refer to?
options: Responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix.
Functional manager
Stakeholder register
Project sponsor.
questions.explanation:
Assignment Matrix (RAM) or (RACI) matrix, shows the connection between work packages or activities 
and team members. RAM Matrix can be used to define the responsibilities of groups or any individual 
team member. 
 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: Your project expense has increased in the last quarter due to the required office space for personnel and some of their travel. What can you do from a resource management planning perspective to address this?
options: Plan to incorporate a virtual team environment, if not done already
Reduce the travel and office equipment cost
Bring all project team members to work from one location
Use video conferencing and web based meetings

questions.question: Two of your team members have come to you due to a difference of opinion between them. What is the best way to resolve this situation?
options: By understanding the needs of both and guiding them towards successful resolution and their full satisfacti
When one of them is very flexible to accept the other person's opinion in front of you
By providing your opinion of who is right
When one of them backs out due to frustration

questions.question: You are planning for project resources and have created a table showing individual roles for varlous tasks in the project. What sort of representation is this called from a resource planning perspective?
options: A project organization chart
A text based format of an organization chart
An OBS
A RACI chart PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: A customer has been consistently late with approvals on design documentation. George, the project manager, has raised the subject in the past, but the practice of delayed approval has not changed. George has been documenting the delays. Which conflict resolution technique Is he following?
options: Collaborating
Compromising
Smoothing
Withdrawal
questions.explanation:
Documenting the delays is not an attempt to solve the problem. This demonstrates avoldance or 
withdrawal as the Project Manager's response to the situation. Collaborating involves attempting to 
solve the problem for deriving an extent of satisfaction to the parties involved in the Issue. The 
situation described here does not indicate any such attempt.

questions.question: The project team members are in conflict are not collaborative and differ in opinion on the architecture. Which of the following phases of Team Development are they in now?
options: Norming
Forming
Storming
Performing
questions.explanation:
There are five stages of Team Development 1) Forming 2) Storming 3) Norming 4) Performing 5) 
Adjourning. In the Storming phase, the team is in conflict as they begin to address the project work, 
technical work, and project management approach. 
 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: During the execution of a project, the project manager discovers that one branch team's tasks are being ineffectively influenced by one team member. What should a project manager use to ensure good working relationships among team members?
options: Team-building activities.
Recognition and rewards.
Interpersonal skills.
Ground rules.
questions.explanation:
Keyword (Ineffectively - good working relationships among team members) The objective of team-
bullding activities is to help individual team members work together effectively. Team-building 
strategies are particularly valuable when team members operate from remote locations without the 
benefit of face-to-face contact. Informal communication and activities can help in bullding trust and 
establishing good working relationships. Note: team-building activities Is a part of Interpersonal skills. 
but here you should use the son not father.

questions.question: Your project team members have just started to work together and are now adjusting their work habits and behaviors to support each other. Which stage of the Tuckman ladder has your team just entered and Once the current stage ends, what is the next stage?
options: The Current stage is Forming and the next stage is Norming
The Current stage is Performing and the next stage is Adjourning.
The Current stage is Forming and the next stage is Storming
The Current stage is Norming and the next stage is Performing
questions.explanation:
The Current stage Is Norming. In this phase, team members begin to work together and adjust their 
work habits and behaviors to support the team. The team members learn to trust each other. Once 
the current stage ends, the next stage Is Performing. Teams that reach the performing stage function 
as a well-organized unit. They are interdependent and work through issues smoothly and effectively. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: You are a project manager of a company, and your project is currently in the execution phase. One of your project teams leave the site early at 3:00 pm Friday and mistreats his colleagues. You would like to establish clear expectations regarding the acceptable behavior of the team member. To avold such situations, you should create:
options: Team-building activities
Interpersonal skills
Management skills
The team charter
questions.explanation:
The team charter establishes clear expectations regarding acceptable behavior by project team 
members.

questions.question: A project manager notices that there is limited participation and contribution from a new team member. What should the project manager do:
options: Review the roles and responsibilities of each team member.
Write a complaint to the human resources department.
Discipline the new team member.
Discuss the situation with the project sponsor.
questions.explanation:
The Project manager should FIRST (Discipline - Correction - Direction) the new team member because 
of his limited participation and contribution. Option (Review the roles and responsibilities of each 
team member. ) not correct because the project manager notices that there Is limited participation 
and contribution from a new team member only not ALL the team members. The project manager 
should be proactive so option (Discuss the situation with the project sponsor & Write a complaint to 
the human resources department) not good practices as a first step.

questions.question: A project to develop a new retall banking product is in progress. The project has fallen behind schedule because team members are lacking motivation. What should the project manager do to motivate the project team?
options: Delegates the responsibilities.
Use coaching and monitoring skills.
Offer recognition and rewards.
Apply creative problem solving. PMP Test Bank 2
questions.explanation:
The team members are lacking motivation. SO the best thing should the project manager do to 
motivate them is to Offer recognition and rewards. People are motivated when they feel they are 
valued in the organization and this value is demonstrated by the rewards given to them. Generally, 
money Is viewed as a tangible aspect of any reward system, but intangible rewards could be equally 
or even more effective. Most project team members are motivated by an opportunity to grow, 
accomplish, be appreciated, and apply their professional skills to meet new challenges. A good 
strategy for project managers is to give the team recognition throughout the life cycle of the project 
rather than waiting until the project is completed.

questions.question: During regular team meetings, the project manager notices that there are clear signs of conflict and Issues related to unclear task assignments and ownership. What should the project manager do to address this?
options: Meet individually with team members to understand the conflicts and issues.
Change the structure of the regular project meetings to improve communication.
Investigate possible ways to improve team collaboration and morale.
Define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix.
questions.explanation:
Keyword (unclear task assignments and ownership). A RACI Matrix is a useful tool to use to ensure 
clear assignment of roles and responsibilities when the team consists of internal and external 
resources. SO the project manager should 
Define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix to adress 
this situation.

questions.question: The project manager for a virtual team is struggling to track progress and productivity because the team is spread out over several time zones. What should the project manager do to enhance communication?
options: Set up a Kanban board .
Create and update the issue log.
Establish an information-sharing portal.
Update the lessons learned register.
questions.explanation:
Communication technology is Important in addressing the team development issues in colocated and 
virtual teams. It helps build a harmonious environment for the colocated team and a better 
understanding for the virtual team, especially those working in different time zones. Examples of 
PMP Test Bank 2 
communication technology that may be used are: Shared portal. A shared repository for Information 
sharing (e.g., website, collaboration software or intranet) Is effective for virtual project teams.

questions.question: One month into a 12-month project., a vendor informs the project manager that required project equipment will be delayed. After further investigation, the project manager learns that this vendor has a reputation for underperforming. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
options: Added a backup vendor to the vendor list
Included a contingency buffer in the schedule baseline
Reviewed the lessons learned documents from other projects
Check the updated risk register and issue log
questions.explanation:
To prevent this situation, the project manager should have reviewed the lessons learned documents 
from other projects to know more about the reputation of vendor...

questions.question: A stakeholder who was incorrectly classified as a supporter Is now reluctant and the project manager becomes worried. What should the project manager do more carefully in future projects?
options: Conduct a meeting with senior management
Create the stakeholders engagement assessment matrix
Develop interpersonal skills to manage stakeholder expectations
Identify stakeholders.
questions.explanation:
A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix supports the comparison between the current 
engagement levels of stakeholders and the desired engagement levels required for successful project

Encourage project team members to prioritize the product backlog.
Work with the product owner to ensure the project backlog is prioritized.

questions.question: A project manager at a large corporation has been assigned to oversee a customer experience project. options: Request that the customer service team prioritizes work on queries that are received this week.
Deploy solutions that will track, prioritize, and resolve queries as soon as possible.
Confirm the issues truly exist by conducting a survey and other analyses that may detect the real issue.
Ask senior management to replace the customer service manager with a more qualified one.
questions.explanation:
Deploy solutions that will track, prioritize, and resolve queries as soon as possible. 
Contact the customers in batches and inform them that the issues are being worked on currently.

questions.question: A company is conducting a digital transformation project that has a hard deadline. The marketing team wants to combine this implementation with a new product, and the newly assigned project manager is not aware of all the dependencies. Using a hybrid approach, what should the project manager do to ensure the dependencies are taken into consideration?
options: Facilitate communication promoting a Scrum of Scrums so the different teams are aware of the dependencies and progress.
Combine all of the small projects into one big project so the team can collaborate better as one big team.
Make sure that each individual project schedule is aligned with the common deadlines. PMP Test Bank 2
Implement a project newsletter so the different team members can be informed about the progress of each project.
questions.explanation:
Facilitate communication promoting a Scrum of Scrums so the different teams are aware of the 
dependencies and progress.

work together to deliver complex solutions. It helps teams develop and deliver complex products

questions.question: A team has individual daily start times for each team member. Sometimes the overlap between team member working hours is short. During those times, the interactions and work as a team are reduced and ineffective. What should the project manager do?
options: Inform the team members who are joining late to join early and work together.
Allocate the overlap time for each team member and ask them to adhere to the schedule.
Ask the team to start at the same time to obtain the maximum number of team working hours.
Ask the team to define a team charter and agree on core working hours.
questions.explanation:
The correct answer is: Ask the team to define a team charter and agree on core working hours. 
The project manager should facilitate a discussion with the team to develop a team charter that 
includes agreements on core working hours. This approach allows the team to define their 
expectations and align their schedules to maximize collaboration and effectiveness. It also promotes 
accountability and ownership among team members. The project manager should ensure that the 
team charter is documented and communicated to all team members, including stakeholders, to 
ensure everyone is aware of the agreed-upon working hours.

questions.question: A team shared a complaint regarding the scrum master during the last sprint review. The team expressed that they were delayed because the scrum master did not remove impediments, such as scheduling some meetings with external teams and obtaining a room to work collaboratively, among other critical blockers. What should the project manager do?
options: Request the team review and prioritize the open impediments to resolve all of them as soon as possible.
Determine and agree when a situation becomes an impediment to be solved by the scrum master.
Push back, explaining that a self-organized team should address all of the problems to get the work done.
Request an additional resource to assist in solving all of the impediments listed by the team.
questions.explanation:
The correct answer IS: Determine and agree when a situation becomes an impediment to be solved by 
the scrum master. 
Scrum Masters are responsible for ensuring that the team can work efficiently and effectively, and 
one of their primary duties is to remove any Impediments that may block the team's progress. 
However, what constitutes an impediment can vary between teams, so it is essential to define and 
agree upon what situations should be considered impediments to be addressed by the Scrum Master. 
 
 
PMP Test Bank 2

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically an input to the process of developing the project management plan?
options: Project charter
Stakeholder register
Enterprise environmental factors
Organizational process assets
questions.explanation: The stakeholder register is used during planning but is not an input to developing the overall project management plan; the project charter, EEFs, and OPAs are standard inputs. (Source: public PMI sample/simplified guides.)

questions.question: A contractor notifies you that a crucial delivery will be delayed, and the vendor has a known history of late shipments. Which proactive step should the project manager have taken during planning to reduce this risk?
options: Added the vendor to the lessons-learned repository
Included a backup supplier or alternative sourcing in the procurement plan
Accepted the delay and documented it in the issue log
Moved the activity to the critical path
questions.explanation: Adding backup suppliers or alternative sourcing during procurement planning is a common mitigation for sole-source or unreliable vendors; this reduces single-vendor dependency and schedule risk.

questions.question: During a sprint retrospective the team identifies that overcommitment caused the sprint to fail. What should the Scrum team have done differently when planning the sprint?
options: The product owner should have assigned more stories to the team
The development team should have determined how many stories they can commit to
The scrum master should assign tasks to individual members
The sponsor should approve additional resources
questions.explanation: In Scrum, the development team determines how much work it can commit to for the sprint; overcommitment is avoided by team-driven capacity planning.

questions.question: A previously unidentified threat emerges late in a project. Which budget reserve should the project manager use if the work is within scope but was unforeseen?
options: Cost baseline
Contingency reserves
Management reserves
Work performance data
questions.explanation: Management reserves are held for unforeseen work (unknown unknowns) and are used for work that was not planned; using them requires an approved change to the cost baseline.

questions.question: Which communication method is best to avoid misunderstandings when a supplier must clarify detailed technical requirements?
options: Push communication (email)
Pull communication (repository)
Interactive communication (discussion/meeting)
Manual distribution
questions.explanation: Interactive communication (two-way verbal or virtual discussion) enables clarification and reduces misunderstandings when detailed technical information must be confirmed.

questions.question: Which document links requirements to the deliverables that satisfy them and is used to manage scope changes?
options: Requirements documentation
Requirements traceability matrix
Work breakdown structure
Project charter
questions.explanation: The requirements traceability matrix maps requirements to their origin and the deliverables that satisfy them, helping manage scope and changes.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of a supportive stakeholder? (Select all that apply)
options: Unaware of potential impacts
Aware of potential impacts and resistant to change
Aware of potential impacts and supportive of change
Actively engaged in project success
questions.explanation: Supportive stakeholders are aware of potential impacts and generally supportive of the change; they may also be actively engaged in project success. (Based on stakeholder engagement classifications.)
